meanings.definition: To pull or drag with effort or force.
meanings.sent1: The workers hauled the heavy boxes up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The truck hauled the broken car to the mechanic.
meanings.sent3: The little dog hauled the giant bone across the yard.
meanings.sent4: She hauled her tired body out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant hauled the large crumb to its nest.

meanings.definition: To transport or carry something heavy.
meanings.sent1: The sailors hauled the fishing nets onto the boat.
meanings.sent2: The crane hauled the massive container onto the ship.
meanings.sent3: The kids hauled the huge watermelon to the picnic area.
meanings.sent4: He hauled the old sofa out of the house with difficulty.
meanings.sent5: The strong ox hauled the heavy cart through the muddy road.

meanings.sent1: The cat hauled the toy mouse back to its bed.
meanings.sent2: The detective hauled the stolen jewels back to the museum.
meanings.sent3: She hauled her brother's borrowed book back to him.
meanings.sent4: The wind hauled the fallen leaves back into the garden.
meanings.sent5: The wave hauled the lost sandcastle back to the shore.
